parameters.name: export
parameters.description: query boolean Whether to include all element content in the returned data. If export= false , the returned data includes only information about the element itself. If export= true , all content, including subelements, is included. The default value is false .

parameters.name: page_limit
parameters.description: query integer The number of records to return in each page of results. The default page limit is 100.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: query boolean Whether to include information about the number of records returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: query string The attribute by which returned results will be sorted. To reverse the sort order, prefix the value with a minus sign ( - ). Supported values are entity and updated .

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: query string A token identifying the last object from the previous page of results.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: InputData The user input.

parameters.name: alternate_intents
parameters.description: boolean Whether to return more than one intent. Set to true to return all matching intents. For example, return all intents when the confidence is not high to allow users to choose their intent. The default value is false .

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context State information for the conversation. To maintain state, include the Context object from the previous response when sending multiple requests for the same conversation, .

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: RuntimeEntity[ ] Entities to use when evaluating the message. Include entities from the previous response to continue using those entities rather than detecting entities in the new input.

parameters.name: intents
parameters.description: RuntimeIntent[ ] Intents to use when evaluating the user input. Include the intents from the previous response to continue using those intents rather than trying to recognize intents in the new input.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: OutputData System output. Include the output from the previous response to maintain intermediate informationif you have several requests within the same dialog turn.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: body json UpdateWorkspace The JSON data defining the new and updated workspace content. Note : The maximum size for this data is 50MB. If you need to import a larger workspace, consider importing the workspace without intents and entities and then adding them separately.
